title: Apple's Vision Pro 2 Leak Reveals Future Plans for Mixed Reality
originSummary: Apple's second-generation virtual reality headset, codenamed Project Alaska, has been leaked, with similarities to the current Apple Vision Pro headset but with some subtle differences such as flat and uniform speakers and simpler rear straps.
Project Alaska is speculated to be a cheaper model compared to the Apple Vision Pro 2.

Production validation testing for Project Alaska is scheduled for 2025, aligning with Bloomberg's predicted roadmap for future Apple products, indicating Apple's commitment to mixed reality and their plans for augmented reality to eventually replace the iPhone.

title: Apple Vision Pro 2 leak reveals design updates and potential release date for headset
originSummary: Apple's upcoming VR/AR headset, the Apple Vision Pro 2, is rumored to have a design similar to its predecessor, with some minor changes.
The changes include a flatter shape for the speakers, variations in the design of the top vents, and simpler rear straps.
The headset is expected to retain most of the sensors, cameras, and the external battery pack of the current model.
Production validation testing is scheduled for 2025, indicating a potential release date of late 2025 or early 2026.
Apple is also considering making the Vision Pro 2 lighter, more compact, and more comfortable.

title: Apple Introduces Spatial Video Recording on iPhone 15 Pro and 15 Pro Max with iOS 17.2 Beta 2
originSummary: The latest beta release of iOS 17.2 introduces spatial video recording support for the upcoming iPhone 15 Pro and 15 Pro Max.
Users can shoot spatial videos that are compatible with the upcoming Apple Vision Pro headset.
Spatial videos are recorded at 1080p resolution with 30 fps, occupying around 130MB of storage per minute of capture.

title: Apple Unveils Vision Pro Headset: A Game-Changing Mixed Reality Experience
originSummary: Apple has announced the Vision Pro headset at the Worldwide Developers Conference, which is expected to be a significant advancement in mixed reality technology.
The headset will come with Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5, and Ultra-low Latency Audio capabilities, along with several sensors like a compass, magnetometer, gyroscope, and ambient light sensor.

Rumored features of the Vision Pro include dual micro OLED screens, a TrueDepth sensor, four Computer Vision optics, two RGB cameras, and dual low-light infrared illuminators. It is set to be released in late 2025 with a starting price of $3,499.

title: Apple Introduces Spatial Video Recording for iPhone 15 Pro in iOS 17.2 Beta, Compatible with Vision Pro Headset
originSummary: Apple is adding a new feature to the iPhone 15 Pro that allows users to capture 3D videos called Spatial Videos.
The videos can be viewed on Apple's upcoming mixed reality headset, the Vision Pro, as well as on standard devices.
The feature is currently available in the iOS 17.2 beta and is expected to be officially released in the near future.

title: Xreal Air AR Glasses: Enhancing the iPhone 15 Digital Experience
originSummary: The Xreal Air AR glasses are a new accessory for the iPhone 15 that enhance the digital experience.
Priced between $300 and $500, these glasses have a built-in projector screen that reflects digital content onto the lenses, allowing users to view both digital and real-world content simultaneously.
The glasses are compatible with the entire iPhone 15 line and can be used for gaming and productivity purposes.

title: Meta Quest 3: The Future of XR Technology Unveiled
originSummary: The Meta Quest 3 is an XR device that merges virtual reality with the real world.
Powered by the Snapdragon XR2 chipset, it provides impressive graphics and immersive audio.
It is versatile, serving various purposes such as gaming, entertainment, productivity, and education.

title: Apple's Next-Gen Vision Pro Headset Leaked: What to Expect
originSummary: Apple is developing a second-generation Vision Pro mixed reality headset, known as "Project Alaska" with the device number N109.
The new headset is expected to have a redesigned look, external accessories like an audio accessory and battery pack, and minor hardware improvements.
The release of the second-generation headset is slated for after the launch of the first-generation Vision Pro in early 2024, which will cost $3,499.
